history.content: The nice stainless-steel barbecue I bought from you is starting to stain after only 2 uses -- how can I clean it?

I'm sorry to hear that you are having trouble with your Snow Peak Takibi Fire & Grill. Some customers have reported success with cleaning the grill by soaking it in vinegar overnight to remove the rust and then oiling it after, essentially seasoning it as if it were made out of cast iron or carbon steel. However, please note that this may not work for everyone and we recommend following the manufacturer's instructions for cleaning and maintenance. If you have any further questions or concerns, please let us know.
What are the instructions for cleaning and maintenance?

history.content: This thing won't nearly get warm enough. How am I supposed to cook my steaks with this thing?

I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble getting your food cooked with the product you purchased. Just to clarify, are you referring to the Snow Peak Takibi Fire & Grill that you purchased on your most recent order? If so, this product is designed to be used as a portable grill and fire pit, and it may take some time to get the fire hot enough to cook your food. However, if you're still having trouble, I can provide you with some tips on how to use the product more effectively. Would you like me to do that?
Yes, please.

history.content: I'm having trouble setting up my new tent. The poles don't seem to fit properly. Can you help me out?

I'm sorry to hear that you're having trouble with your tent. It looks like you purchased The North Face Wawona 6 Tent from your recent order. I'd be happy to help you with the setup process. First, please ensure that you have all the necessary components, including poles, stakes, and guylines. If any parts are missing or damaged, we can arrange for replacements. Can you confirm that you have all the required components?
Yes, I have all the components. It's just the poles that are giving me a hard time.
